title: Ekko is going to go jg, and get nerfed to oblivion for it.
body:
his kit is perfect for it
slows
gapcloser/lichbane proc
2.25 second stun
shields
placement reset so he can towerdive

replies.body: he has a built in shield and aoe damage, hell be fine camp clear wise.
Please respond to comments if you're talking to someone...

if he has it on chronological he might have responded to their comment directly. 

Edited *For clarity*

Um, you might want to doublecheck.

Because I... don't have it on chronological.

no, you may not, but he may. There is a button that switches between chronological and discussion view. You have it in discussion view, but he may have it in chronological view. Look right above where it says "leave a comment" and you can type in the box, right above there is a link that says switch to chronological view. Look at that and you may find that he did try and reply to you.

He might be trying, but he's not doing it properly.

You can still respond to comments (and therefore give people notifications) in chronological view.

Ekko? Is that you?
if he can actually survive the jungle that is
I don't think his kit will give him great clear, tbh
{{item:3713}} you can buy clear...

when people talk about clear they are referring to first clear.

Anyone can clear the jungle after their first back, but if you use both health pots and finish your first clear at 150 hp, youre gonna have a bad time.

Stun is very unreliable and probably wont land on anyone with mobility. 

Placement rest only goes so far. Although timing it with tower shots will be enough even if he cannot escape out of it's range on use. 

I don't think he'll be bad at it, but you are over hyping it a bit.
WIth experience playing Ekko, I can say the only real use for the W is zoning them away from you, or tossing it behind them so they can't run that way. And, his clear is horrendous.

unless ekko is on the same team as {{champion:45}}  ;o

5 second stun mid-late game

{{champion:45}} cages, ekko places W, then walks into it right after Veigar's cage disappears

I sense ekko would have great synergy with vei
The placement reset also make him untargetable for tiny bit, so tower aggro will reset as well

The stun could be really, really good for baron/dragon steals though. From the spotlight it looks like it'll cover either all or most of the pits if you want to flash over, or a huge space in front to get the team in. I'll test this on PBE tomorrow when I get the update installed. Slow internets :P

also what looks like a shitty as camp clear

Ill even go so far as to guess his gank style

run in, throw his q, line up his w, e when the enemy gets to his w aoe, crap tons o damage and 2.25 stun
Hes basically Diana in a lot of ways, so yeah he can jungle
I hope he can jungle, I want more diverse junglers and the tank junglers are becoming boring.

Ekko seems kinda dumb

An Assassin who doesn't have Burst is just a squishy Fighter, not an Assassin. They even say he's more for Skirmishing which is even more Fighter esque

but he does have good clearing potential.

lvl 1 he has his passive and if you start w he has his execute autos. so you can take golems very fast with a halfway decent leash.  he wont be overly dependent on mana early since his stuff has such long cds.

so we get lvl 1 w execute+shield which is a good enough shield it will block 2-3 golem attacks, plus the smite from golems effect.

come to lvl 2 taking q. 120+.8AP damage to the crows camp should be enough that you can quickly execute the lil crows, and starting your pots as you take down the big crow.

red camp time, your w is up by this point, as well as smite. the damage of your q, plus the 2.25 second stun and shield/golem passive should quickly let you take it down.

back and get chilling smite

lvl 3 take e and time to gank. your w will be thrown behind the target to either catch them or force a path, the slow from your passive and q should let your laners catch up and hopefully get the kill.

runes I see spellvamp quints, armor yellows and AP reds and blues.

masteries I see 17-0-13 with the offense tree starting AS mastery and working down the AP side to get the spellblade mastery and maxing executioner.
on the utility side make sure you get the spellvamp, jungle buff length and 40 starting gold masteries.
Dude. Come on. We even tried telling you.

Ive watched a few hours of people streaming playing him jungle.

And even ignoring people being new with him, i just cant see it working out.

His clear is passable, not amazing, not terrible.

But his ganks are absolutely useless. The setup time on his W is just too long to ever be used effectively in the gank. By the time the zone is set up, the gank is already a success or a failure.

His stun is the easiest thing in the world to dodge since you can see it coming. It takes 3 seconds for the damn thing to actually shoot off and during a good majority of that time, you see the big blue circle appear on the floor.... lol.

Clear-wise, he's not bad at clearing, but he's almost pure single target outside of his Q. He's also pretty damn squishy. 

Then there's even more about his W... it doesn't synergize in the jungle. The shield is 2s long and it stuns for 2.25s. You'll never be able to put the shield to use, though that 2.25s is nice, but it won't really help. 

The biggest offender to him as a jungler though? His passive. It has a CD. You can only hit targets so often with them, which makes him all burst and no sustained, which is what he's supposed to be. Hit and run. His kit allows him to hit and run.

I guess you could go AD though like idiots on the PBE are doing and try to be Master Yi, but he'll always do better as AP since it's a lot safer, a lot burstier, and a lot more entertaining.

I'm looking forward to jungling with him. Starting out a gank by tossing Parellel Convergence behind the enemy. Cutting off them running directly backwards forcing them into a bush. If they do run into it I can just Phase Dive into the Parellel Convergence and beat them to death while they're being slowed from my passive. He seems like he's a great champion for Jungle.

I think his clears will be pretty bad. His W passive only takes effect from 30% and lower. Once he makes it past his first clear or two he will probably be alright, but no reason to pick him over mainstream, so I doubt he will be nerfed.

I don't know... He has no sustain (Has to wait like 4 seconds for his shield, so that will slow his clears down and make him behind the other junger if he shields with all the camps), his mana problems (If using abilities to farm, which you have to if you're jungling) will probably force him to either never give blue to allies or never farm and only gank, get as many camps as he can, recall, repeat.
Just be SivHD, and steal his blue then kill him.
wait, he is AP? I always thought he'd be AD.
Yeah, total AD move set, he changes time by punching it.
AD bruiser mains are not always knuckleheads. sometimes the way to solve a problem is by punching it really damn hard.

{{champion:254}} You tell 'em.

To be fair, reality was changed once by a superhero punching it *really hard.*
